results.title: Gattaca [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Niccol, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher and Jersey Films
results.brief_description: Niccol’s debut as a director, a year before he wrote the script for ‘The Truman Show’, is set in a near-future where the lives of the majority of citizens are determined before birth through genetic engineering of their genes, and the ‘natural-born’ minority of ‘In-Valids’ is shunned. Vincent Freeman (Ethan Hawke) is one of the latter, who, in order to pursue his goal of travelling into space, assumes the identity of a member of the genetic elite (Jude Law). His cover is threatened when he becomes a suspect in a murder investigation. With a relentless investigator in pursuit and the colleague he has fallen in love with beginning to suspect his deception, his dreams begin to unravel. Cast includes Uma Thurman, Ethan Hawke, Alan Arkin, Jude Law and Ernest Borgnine.

results.title: Letter for an angel = Surat untuk bidadari (D)
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho, Budiyati Abiyoga and Prasidi Teta Film
results.brief_description: Set in a remote village in Nusa Tenggara, this haunting film follows the story of a young boy, Lewa. Smitten by Lewa’s surrogate mother, a local honcho kills Lewa’s father in order to marry her. One by one, the people around Lewa are taken away from him, in response he writes to an ‘angel’, seeking answers to the events that have befallen him. The film showcases the Sumba culture, with traditional ceremonies shot in a documentary style, including scenes of real animal sacrifices which are quite explicit (do not expect a ‘no animals were harmed’ disclaimer at the end as the scenes are not staged). Garin Nugroho’s second feature was awarded Best Film at the Taormina Film Festival in Italy and Gold Prize at the Young Cinema Competition, Tokyo International Film Festival 1994. Cast includes Nurul Arifin, Adi Kurdi and Jajang Pamontjak. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Love on a slice of bread = Cinta dalam sepotong roti
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho, Budiyati Abiyoga and Prasidi Teta Film
results.brief_description: Director Garin Nugroho’s first feature is the story of three childhood friends caught in a love triangle. Topan, a photographer, visits his childhood friends who have married each other. The three of them end up travelling to Lombok together, which proves to be not such a good idea. The husband is revealed to be sexually incompetent and he ends up having an affair with Topan’s photographic model (although to what extent remains unclear as the film was censored by the Indonesian Censorship Board). Meanwhile, Mayang finds out that she has more in common with Topan than her husband. This is arguably Nugroho’s most mainstream effort. Later on, he went on to develop his hallmark strengths - intricate cultural nuances, sparse dialogue and a sense of hightened realism. This film won Best Film at the Indonesian Film Festival in 1991 and Best young Director at the Asia-Pacific Film Festival in South Korea in the same year. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Love lessons = Lust och Fagring Stor
results.creator_credit: Bo Widerberg, Per Holst, Danske Filminstitut, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Set in 1943 in Malmo (Sweden) ‘Love Lessons’ follows the sexual awakening of Stig (Johan Widerberg, the director’s son), a 15 year old student, with his teacher Viola (Marika Lagercrantz), 22 year his senior. At the beginning of the school year Stig is just one more adolescent, as ignorant as he is curious about women and sex. He develops an immediate crush on his new teacher, Viola, who is unhappily married to an alcoholic travelling salesman. Breaking every ethical code, Viola spends every afternoon giving Stig love lessons, until the day the young man meets Viola’s husband and becomes sympathetic to his plight. Sharing his time between a demanding lover and an unexpected friend, Stig’s life becomes even more complex when the young girl living next door directs her affection towards him. Feeling Stig’s love waning, Viola extracts a petty revenge on him, perhaps teaching the young man the ultimate love lesson: “hell hath no fury like a woman’s scorn”. Winner of the Silver Bear award at the Berlin Film Festival 1995. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Steam-driven adventures of Riverboat Bill
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, Film Victoria and Phantascope
results.brief_description: Based on the Riverboat Bill books by Cliff Green. Riverboat Bill and young Dave Freshwater restore an old paddle-steamer, and, along with a fire breathing Bunyip and Black Ben the Pirate, have many adventures sailing the Murray River. Frank Thring Jr as the Bunyip’s voice.
results.description: Based on the Riverboat Bill books by Cliff Green. Riverboat Bill and young Dave Freshwater restore an old paddle-steamer, and, along with a fire breathing Bunyip and Black Ben the Pirate, have many adventures sailing the Murray River. Frank Thring Jr as the Bunyip’s voice.

results.title: Peter Pan
results.creator_credit: Vincent J. Donehue, Richard Halliday and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: Based on the Broadway musical production of James Barrie’s classic children’s story, this made for television version of ‘Peter Pan’ stars Mary Martin, who also played the lead role in the stage play. Forty-seven years old at the time, Martin is nevertheless convincing as Peter Pan, the little boy that won’t grow up who whisks the Darling children out of their London nursery and off to Never Never Land. Song highlights include: “I’ve Gotta Crow,” “I’m Flying,” “I Won’t Grow Up,” “Neverland,” Ugg-a-Wugg” and “Hook’s Waltz.

results.title: Innocence unprotected = Nevinost bez zastite
results.creator_credit: Dusan Makavejev, Bosko Savic and Avala Film
results.brief_description: The first all-Serbian talkie feature rescued from oblivion by Makavejev was made in 1942 during the Nazi Occupation, a naive melodrama in which a strong man (played by the filmmaker, a real life strong man-cum-Houdini type) rescues the heroine from a lecher and a wicked stepmother. It was banned by the Occupation government for attracting local audiences away from more sophisticated German fare, then denounced after the war for being German-inspired. Makavejev colour tinted the footage to highlight its folk charm. Through a dialectical approach to montage he provides an ironic commentary on the themes of innocence and time by intercutting the fictional footage, interviews with members of the original production and wartime newsreels. In Serbo-Croatian with English subtitles. Cast includes Ivanka Vukasovic, Dragoljub Gojkovic Beli and Miodrag Petrovic Sarlo. Note: Original film directed by Dragolyub Aleksic.

results.title: Tales of the Taira Clan = Shin heiki monogatari
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Set in twelfth-century Japan against a rich social and political background, this is an epic tale of power struggles, family drama, and human frailty. Mizoguchi lavished everything - sumptuous colour, elaborate sets and costumes - on this gripping drama, making his penultimate film - only one of two films he made in colour - a masterpiece. In Japanese with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: Tales of the Taira Clan = Shin heiki monogatari

results.title: Ordet = The Word
results.creator_credit: Carl Theodor Dreyer and Palladium Films
results.brief_description: Ordet = (The Word) is film that explores the polarities of faith and the journey from hypocrisy to true faith. In a remote village in Denmark, two families feud as a result of opposing religious faiths and their religious intolerance. Old Borgen’s family is further tested when his son, Johannes is driven mad by reading Kierkegarde and believes he is the risen Christ. Dreyer simply explores the notion of faith by illustrating the inadequacies of doctrines when pitted against people with profound needs. True faith is explored when the family turn in desperation to each other as Inger, the wife of Borgen’s older son Mikkel and light of the family unexpectedly dies. Dreyer reduces the sound in the film in a way that creates a meditative atmosphere heightening its religious theme. In Danish with English subtitles.

results.title: Clubbed to death
results.creator_credit: Yolande Zauberman, Alain Massiot and Madar
results.brief_description: Set in the outskirts of Paris, “Clubbed to death” offers a fresh perspective of the rave culture by setting it’s story amongst the Arab and African immigrant community that populate these poorer suburbs and vibrant dance scene. Elodie Bouchez (‘Dream life of angels’(1998), ‘Wild reeds’ (1994)) plays Lola, a 20 year-old club kid who falls asleep on the bus home one night and wakes to find herself in the middle of a popular night spot where local Arab and African teenagers go to party. On this eventful evening Lola pops an E and meets and falls in love with a boxer called Emir (Roschdy Zem). Like Alice in wonderland finding herself on the other side of the rabbit hole, the drugged out Lola must overcome various obstacles and opponents before she can be with her man. Her biggest hurdle’s are Emir’s vampy girlfriend and club podium dancer Saida (Beatrice Dalle), whose love for him borders on the obsessive, and Emir’s own struggle with heroin addiction. Director Yolande Zauberman chooses to treat this twilight world in a naturalistic, unflashy way through the use of hand held camera but heightens the visuals and narrative through the impressive electronic soundtrack which includes dance artists such as Massive Attack, Daft Punk and the Chemical Brothers. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Richard Courchet, Gerald Thomassin and Julie Bataille.

Her biggest hurdle’s are Emir’s vampy girlfriend and club podium dancer Saida (Beatrice Dalle), whose love for him borders on the obsessive, and Emir’s own struggle with heroin addiction. Director Yolande Zauberman chooses to treat this twilight world in a naturalistic, unflashy way through the use of hand held camera but heightens the visuals and narrative through the impressive electronic soundtrack which includes dance artists such as Massive Attack, Daft Punk and the Chemical Brothers. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Richard Courchet, Gerald Thomassin and Julie Bataille.
